info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 19 at 7:53PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following county, Charleston. * WHEN...Until 915 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 747 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated a nearly stationary cluster of showers and thunderstorms with torrential rains over Mount Pleasant, Sullivans Island, Isle of Palms and Dewees Island. As much as 1 to 3 inches of rain has fallen in this area this evening. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. Motorists driving US-17 between the Ravenel Bridge and Whitehall Terrace should be on alert for flooded areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mount Pleasant, Isle Of Palms, Sullivan`s Island, Mount Pleasant Towne Centre, Boone Hall Plantation, Sullivans Island, Capers Inlet, Hamlin Plantation, Seaside Farms, Mount Pleasant Hospital, Wild Dunes, Whitehall Terrace, Snowden, East Cooper Regional Medical Center, Dewees Island, Ion, Fort Moultrie, The Old Village, Hobcaw Point and Remleys Point.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
